content.raw: some thoughts: if we detect a trajectory pose cmd, we should be able to bypass most of the computation in `SceneManager::ActorMeshAnimationAt` \(the first half of the function that checks for trajectory\). You can also see that `_time` is being updated in that function so it can retrieve the skeleton local transforms at the correct time point in the skeleton animation, see [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/dd4ff2a4c1112a8727c12a2e927e87ca64392611/src/rendering/SceneManager.cc#lines-925). Most of the logic there is to sync skeleton animation with trajectory pose animation from sdf. Not sure if this makes sense?
